name: nytimes
text:

text:

name: nytimes
text: The coronavirus is raging in Latin America. Meet some of the health workers who are risking their lives — and those of their families — to fight the pandemic. https://t.co/myN8SIyc2v

name: nytimes
text: Before he was infected with the coronavirus, Pablo Trujillo wore a snorkeling mask, which he adapted with a ventilator filter for protection. He spent 12 days in the I.C.U. in Mexico City where he works, and during that time, 7 of his colleagues died. https://t.co/9uPwxXrs6a https://t.co/ZMewuwkMNa

name: nytimes
text:
"Many people want everything to go back to ‘normal.’ I don’t want to go back to what is ‘normal’ here for Indigenous lives,” says Vanda Ortega Witoto, a nursing technician in Manaus, Brazil. She started a food donation campaign when lockdown was declared. 
https://t.co/ceG3AsS93q https://t.co/GWIeYpOEPN

name: nytimes
text: “We started off so ill-equipped for this tragedy," says Jesús Valverde, an I.C.U. doctor in Lima, Peru. "Every I.C.U bed in Lima is taken." Jesús has almost doubled his shifts, and lives most of the week at the hospital or the clinic where he works. https://t.co/cs4bHz2pH3 https://t.co/gmL8vYMQqx

name: nytimes
text: Next to the health unit where Alyne Freiberg works in São Paulo, Brazil, there was a community center that closed due to lack of funds. “This will mean more children and young people on the streets in a place where violence and drugs are gaining strength.” https://t.co/Fqq5YO30pa https://t.co/KlLNKetKpY

name: nytimes
text:
RT @cliffordlevy: Facts: 
• NYT reported that intelligence about Russia paying bounties to kill US troops was in Trump’s written daily brief.
• He rarely reads daily brief.
• His aides refuse to comment on that.
• Aides insist Trump was not "verbally" briefed.
